attributes.action: Ban the Conservatives from using the term “Anti-Growth Coalition”
attributes.additional_details: Ban the term if possible, or at least raise it as an issue. You can’t just declare the working population as “Anti-Growth” and pretend there’s an enemy of the people.
attributes.background: Ask the Conservatives to stop using the term “Anti-Growth Coalition” as it seems to encompass everyone who isn’t in the conservative party. I personally find it offensive. And disagreeing with the current government’s “plans” is not “Anti-Growth”, it is reasonable sanity.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about what language to use are a matter for individual politicians and political parties, not the UK Government or Parliament.
